text: Hi.
I'm Mike.
And I'm Steven.
We're the founders of Fleetzero.

We're building
battery-electric cargo ships.

We're both marine engineers
and lifelong friends.

So we believe the
only sustainable way

to decarbonize an industry
like shipping is to do it
for less than it costs today.

So our innovation
is to put batteries

inside standard
shipping containers.

And what this allows us to do
is when our ships come into port

and their batteries
are depleted,

we can actually swap those
batteries out for a charged set

and get the ship back
to sea more quickly,
back to generating revenue.

More importantly, this gives us
a really cool economy of scale.

Instead of having to have
really big ships, like you

do with fossil fuels
and combustion engines,

we can actually be super
efficient with multiple smaller

ships by distributing the cost
of batteries over the fleet.

And this gives us
a cost advantage
to fossil-fuel shipping.

So the biggest issue facing
the shipping industry today
is decarbonization.

Shipping companies are facing
a tremendous amount of pressure
from customers and regulators.

And currently proposed solutions
like biofuels, hydrogen,

ammonia require new,
complex infrastructure.
They're expensive.

And they're not necessarily
better for the environment.

We believe the future
of shipping is electric.
Thanks.
Thank you.
